comments:
I create a DB2 connection and log in as user DB2ADMIN.  There is no schema of that name.  When I try to run the Generate Entities operation, I get an NPE and the wizard never appears.  I would expect this case to be handled and have a way to set the desired schema (if the assumption of "schema==loggedInUser" is not valid), or at the very least show an error message. 

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.jst.jpa.ui.wizards.GenerateEntitiesWizard.getPossibleTables(GenerateEntitiesWizard.java:108)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jpa.ui.wizards.GenerateEntitiesWizardPage.createControl(GenerateEntitiesWizardPage.java:120)
	at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.Wizard.createPageControls(Wizard.java:259)
	at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.WizardDialog.createPageControls(WizardDialog.java:629)
	at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.WizardDialog.createContents(WizardDialog.java:514)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.create(Window.java:426)
	at org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.Dialog.create(Dialog.java:1111)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jpa.ui.actions.GenerateEntitiesAction.execute(GenerateEntitiesAction.java:60)

We should fix this for this Friday's M6 build since it makes it impossible to choose a different schema than the connection user name.  We should be getting the schema from the persistence unit defaults with the connection user name as a default. But we should still allow the user to choose a different schema and populate the list of tables once they've chosen that schema.
Workaround of disconnecting from the DB before generation was previously given.  I believe this is now fixed.
This issue should be resolve with the latest code. Let us know if it does not on DB2.
